remarks: Alternate definition of a subcategory, as a subset of the category which is itself a category.  The assumption that the identity be closed is necessary just as in the case of a monoid, ~ issubm2 , for the same reasons, since categories are a generalization of monoids.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Jan-2017.)
statement:

issubc3.i $e |- .1. = ( Id ` C ) $.
issubc3.1 $e |- D = ( C |`cat J ) $.
issubc3.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
issubc3.a $e |- ( ph -> J Fn ( S X. S ) ) $.
issubc3 $p |- ( ph -> ( J e. ( Subcat ` C ) <-> ( J C_cat H /\ A. x e. S ( .1. ` x ) e. ( x J x ) /\ D e. Cat ) ) ) $.
